name: Hot Chocolate Fudge
description: Thank you, Debbie Pollard, for this recipe. Nothing says “Happy Holidays” like a batch of heartfelt, homemade chocolate fudge, right? The hot chocolate mix adds rich, dreamy, chocolate flavour—they’re truly bite-size bliss. Gift some to your loved ones, make a batch for bake sales, or serve to guests with Summer Berry Sweet Dip.

ingredients.name: semi-sweet chocolate chips and milk chocolate chips

preparation:
1. Line Square or Multipurpose Steamer with parchment paper.
  2. In medium saucepan over medium-low heat, combine condensed milk, chocolate chips, and butter. Stir frequently until chocolate is melted. Stir in mix until dissolved and evenly combined.
  3. Remove pan from heat; add vanilla extract and 1⁄2 cup marshmallows. Scrape mixture into steamer. Sprinkle with remaining marshmallows; use back of spoon to press marshmallows into mixture.
  4. Loosely cover and refrigerate 2–4 hrs, or until completely set.
  5. Carefully remove from steamer by lifting parchment paper; cut fudge into 36 squares.
tips: Not a marshmallow fan? Stir in chopped pecans or walnuts, crushed candy canes, M&M’s, or crushed cookies instead.
